DOC.brief_summary: The current study examines whether change-readiness , consequently treatment outcome , enhance Cognitive Behavioral Therapy ( CBT ) severe Generalized Anxiety Disorder ( GAD ) add brief course Motivational Interviewing ( MI adapt anxiety , Westra & Dozois , 2003 ) CBT motivation wane . 106 individual severe GAD randomly assign receive equal number session either MI CBT ( MI-CBT arm ) CBT alone ( CBT alone arm ) . It expect MI-CBT arm relative CBT alone arm show low level resistance CBT , high level homework compliance therapeutic alliance , good moment-to-moment interpersonal process , consequently superior outcome - post-treatment 6 12 month follow-up .
DOC.brief_title: Motivational Interviewing Cognitive Behavioural Therapy Generalized Anxiety Disorder
DOC.detailed_description: The propose study build finding clinical trial Westra , Arkowitz Dozois ( 2009 ) , aim : ( 1 ) provide powerful test value add MI CBT high severity GAD ( pilot data indicate individual severe GAD may preferentially benefit addition MI CBT ) , ( 2 ) employ treatment procedure generalizable clinical practice , ( 3 ) examine mechanism underlie additive treatment benefit . 106 individual principal diagnosis GAD high worry severity randomly assign receive either 4 session MI follow 11 session CBT ( MI-CBT arm ) 15 session CBT ( CBT alone arm ) . Both group also receive 2 follow-up CBT treatment session 1 3 month post-treatment . Each therapist deliver treatment component , treatment appear seamless client , therapist nest within treatment group control allegiance effect avoid cross-contamination therapy . In order increase generalizability clinical practice , CBT phase MI-CBT arm , therapists shift MI presence empirically derive marker resistance shift back CBT resistance diminish . In CBT alone arm therapist respond resistance use manualized recommendation derive lead CBT theorist management resistance . Anxiety relate symptom , motivation , treatment engagement assess various point treatment , 6 12 month post-treatment . A multi-method approach assessment use , include self-report , clinician-report , clinician-administered , observer-rated , interview-based measure . Importantly , include traditional outcome measure , also process measure ( e.g. , observer-coded interpersonal behavior , interview-based derivation client experience ) investigate possible mechanism underlie additive treatment benefit . In addition , therapy session videotape assessed independent raters protocol adherence . The specific hypothesis follow : Hypothesis 1 : Worry , Anxiety , & Related Symptoms . The MI-CBT arm show great reduction worry , anxiety , relate symptom ( depression , disability , maladaptive belief worry , life satisfaction ) great percentage treatment responder ( use clinical significance criterion ) across treatment period follow-up ( FU ) , compare CBT alone arm . Hypothesis 2 : Motivation Resistance . Over course early treatment ( i.e. , session 1 4 ) , MI-CBT arm demonstrate great increase motivation compare CBT alone arm . In addition , MI-CBT arm exhibit lower in-session resistance early ( session 5 & 7 ) , middle ( session 10 & 12 ) , late ( session 15 & 17 ) phase treatment . Hypothesis 3 : Homework Compliance . The MI-CBT arm show great client- therapist-rated homework compliance throughout CBT treatment compare CBT alone arm . Hypothesis 4a : Interpersonal Processes Clients Therapists . Compared CBT alone client , MI-CBT client therapist report high work alliance quality initial MI session subsequent phase CBT . Furthermore , moment-to-moment interpersonal process client therapist early , middle , late treatment expect characterized adaptive process ( e.g. , high affiliation less hostility ) MI-CBT vs. CBT alone arm . Hypothesis 4b . Interpersonal Processes During Resistance . During episodes client resistance ( identify resistance cod ) , therapist client exchange MI-CBT expect characterized adaptive process ( i.e. , high affiliation , less hostility , great client autonomy-preservation ) compare CBT alone . Further , small subset client ( 5 per treatment group ) interview experience resistance episode , expect client account MI-CBT arm characterize positively ( e.g. , supportive client autonomy , conducive increase engagement vs. disengagement treatment ) compare CBT alone . Hypothesis 5 : Mediation Therapeutic Outcomes . We expect increase motivation reduce resistance MI-CBT , compare CBT alone , lead high level engagement CBT ( well homework compliance therapeutic alliance ) , result great worry reduction .
DOC.criteria: Between 16 & 65 year age Proficient use English A principle diagnosis Generalized Anxiety Disorder ( GAD ) Severe GAD ( measure clinician severity rating PSWQ ) Willingness either remain stable dosage psychotropic medication remain unmedicated throughout involvement clinical trial Current history psychotic spectrum disorder bipolar mood disorder Cognitive impairment neurodegenerative illness head injury Current substance abuse dependance Concurrent psychotherapy , either individual group .
